English.Text: Following the hinds of an battered treasure map given to you by an gritty old sailer in the tavern the other day, you decide to continue his search for a mysterious place called Mayabeque, hidden somewhere in the depths of the Jungle.

Your lookout reports a galleon slowly approaching on the horizon. The ship is flying the royal flag and you suspect something sinister. The Queen has probably learnt of Vasco's plans and is now trying to slow you down to prevent the rise of a new colonial power. Your second officer approaches you: "Admiral, how should we deal with the pursuer?" Do we try to negotiate, try to shake them off or try to sink them?
Send a delegation to the royal ship

Your business-savvy diplomat is successful. He has easily convinced the mercenaries that your ship is on its way to the New World to visit the Queen's nephew, who is the governor of one of here colonies there.

At the sight of the rowdy pack of buccaneers, your diplomat begins to stammer: "W...W..We're on our way to Taka-Tuka Land to steal a fabled pirate treasure!" A roar of laughter erupts. Nobody believes his story. Perhaps something else can convince the crowd of your impeccable intentions?

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.1.2.1 Diplomacy fail - Bribe instead

English.Text: Offer a bribe to make the mercenaries forget about your encounter.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.1.2.1.1 Diplomacy fail - Bribe instead: Bribe offer

English.Text: "You have been observed making joint efforts with the enemy while meeting with him on his Flagship. Whatever you discussed, this is considered high treason and therefore unacceptable in Her Majesty's seas. Unless..." he winks grotesquely, "...we can come to some arrangement?"

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.1.2.1.1.1 Diplomacy fail - Bribe instead: Accept option
The Queen's Intervention 1.1.2.1.1.1.1 Diplomacy fail - Bribe instead: Success: final success

English.Text: The amount of gold on offer makes the buccaneers' eyes widen noticeably. Their leader licks his lips and faster than you would have thought possible, you come to an agreement. The delegation is sent back and the ship that almost ruined your plans for your own colonial power disappears peacefully into the sunset. Now move on quickly, before others get the same idea.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.1.2.1.1.2 Diplomacy fail - Bribe instead: Cancel option
The Queen's Intervention 1.1.2.1.1.2.1 Diplomacy fail - Bribe instead: Cancel: final fail

English.Text: The amount of gold on offer is paltry. A murmur spreads through the group of buccaneers. The leader licks his lips and faster than anyone would have thought possible, he puts a pistol to your diplomat's chest. The delegation is detained and the ship sets sail to Crown Falls in order to hand over the delegation. At least you got off scot-free, but the loss of some of your best men quickly affects the mood of the crew.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.1.2.2 Diplomacy fail - Hypnotize instead

English.Text: Let on of your mans with the special ability to positively enforce his will on others have a go.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.1.2.2.1 Diplomacy fail - Hypnotize instead: success

English.Text: "These aren't the sailors you're looking for!" the hypnotist repeats over and over again as he swings a pocket watch back and forth in front of the buccaneer leader's face. The bystanders are literally hanging on his every word. Finally, the leader says: "These are not the sailors we are looking for! Let them go, they are acting with noble intentions." Your men don't need to be told twice and run for it. As soon as they are back on deck, you immediately set sail and the other ship slowly disappears on the horizon. We just avoided total disaster narrowly.
Hoist the sails and get out of there as quickly and unnoticed as possible

Your men are working hard and your helmsman is doing an excellent job. The wind is favourable and the pursuing ship on the horizon quickly shrinks to the size of a pinhead. "We've shaken them off!" cheers your second officer. "Hopefully the last of such an encounter," you reply, "we can't have any more delays!"

Despite your quick action and the passable skills of your helmsman, the wind has plotted against you. The ship on the horizon is getting bigger and bigger and will soon go alongside. We must find an alternative solution quickly, otherwise we will be locked up in the dungeons of Crown Falls by tomorrow.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.2.2.1 Navigation fail - Crafting instead

English.Text: Try to create a disguise so that the ship looks like an abandoned ghost ship.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.2.2.1.1 Navigation fail - Crafting instead: success

English.Text: Your carpenters get to work quickly. A hole in the hull here and a torn sail there. In addition, a bent mast and a lot of green fog on the deck, which no one really knows where it comes from, but which burns your men's eyes and lungs so much that they easily retreat below deck. The camouflage as a ghost ship is perfect and the enemy ship actually approaches very hesitantly. Not a single scout dares step onto the deck. Your pursuers have trouble steering their ship on the opposite course quickly enough so as not to get too close to the scary monster. After some clean-up work, you can continue your journey unmolested.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.2.2.1.2 Navigation fail - Crafting instead: fail

English.Text: Your men are too slow. The enemy ship quickly comes close and catches you in the middle of converting it into a ghost ship. "What's that supposed to be?" the enemy leader shouts at you mockingly. "We are not afraid of ghosts! But you should be afraid of the concentrated force of the royal state. Tomorrow you will all be imprisoned in Crown Falls for treason."

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.2.2.2 Navigation fail - Faith instead
The Queen's Intervention 1.2.2.2.1 Navigation fail - Faith instead: success

English.Text: Thank God the wind is picking up and you're setting up every sail you can find on deck. Your ship picks up speed quickly and because of the sheer superiority of sail area, the pursuer quickly shrinks to a small dot on the horizon.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.2.2.2.2 Navigation fail - Faith instead: fail

English.Text: God has abandoned you, the sail is still fluttering slackly in the wind, not a breeze is blowing. Surprisingly, your pursuer has perfect conditions and quickly catches up with you. "What kind of lame duck do I see here? Just the right meal for our hungry gang. You won't get far, we'll make sure of that. You're under arrest from now on."
Let the pursuer come closer and unexpectedly open fire on him

Unsuspectingly, the ship comes closer to you. As it begins to move alongside, you scream "Fire!" and a full broadside shreds the enemy's hull. Seawater quickly begins to flood into the hull and after just a few minutes the keel tilts towards the seabed and the rescue boats are lowered into the water. "Be damned!" a sailor shouts over to you. You hope that it is not a bad omen and continue on your way unpursued. It will take forever for the rescuers to get back to Crown Falls.

As the ship comes alongside, you open fire. But your gunners must have eaten too much of the fermented fish this morning, because not a single shot hits the target. The enemy ship is getting closer and closer. What should we do now?

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.3.2.1 Might fail - FormerPirate Perk instead

English.Text: Try to board the enemy ship with your men and capture the crew.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.3.2.1.1 Might fail - FormerPirate Perk instead: success

English.Text: Your people roar in celebration as they transfer over long ropes to the enemy deck. A brief scuffle breaks out, but the enemy's crew is totally demoralized by your behavior and, gritting their teeth, are taken prisoners. You can continue your journey unmolested.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.3.2.2 Might fail - Hunting instead

English.Text: Replace the gunners with experienced Ship Hunters and quickly fire off a second volley, hoping to do more damage.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.3.2.2.1 Might fail - Hunting instead: success

English.Text: Finally a hit! The hull breaks open and water floods the enemy ship. After just a few minutes the keel tilts towards the seabed and the rescue boats are lowered into the water. "Be damned!" a sailor shouts over to you. You hope that it is not a bad omen and continue on your way unpursued. It will take forever for the rescuers to get back to Crown Falls.

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.3.2.2.2 Might fail - Hunting instead: fail

English.Text: Nothing seems to help. Despite the changed operating crew, the cannonballs still splash meters away from the bow of the enemy ship. The ship comes alongside unhesitated and the mercenaries surround your crew. "You won't get far, we'll make sure of that. You're under arrest from now on."
Give up and face your pursuers

Standard.Name: The Queen's Intervention 1.4.1 All fail - fail

English.Text: "You won't get far from now on, we'll make sure of that. You're under arrest!"

Gas and Jaguar Furs Unlock CREATIVE
Quest Mayabeque Gas+Fur1: Paloma Intro after 1250 Obreros
Quest Mayabeque Gas 2: Build Airship Platform on any CliffIsland
Quest Mayabeque Gas 3: Build NW Gas Mine and 3 Modules

English.Text: Thank you for your contribution to my research. Let's quickly fill this airship for a test and look at its new features. Wait, what's that? I hear explosions! Oh no, fire everywhere! Quick, get the fire extinguishers! It seems that this gas is not suitable for my modern airships. Far too volatile. I'll stick with helium for now, even though the new gas may have some advantages, it's far too dangerous for a venture like mine. I won't risk losing any more of my fleet to it. You can keep it, I have no further use for it.

Standard.Name: Quest Mayabeque Gas 4: Build NW Jaguar Hunting Cabin
TextTextCombined Value Quest Gas 4 build airmail sorting office in Mayabeque
